title: happy - Birthdays Reminder App
description: Like many, I once relied on Facebook to remind me of friends' birthdays. But as time went on and my usage of Facebook diminished, I found myself missing out on these special occasions. Alternative solutions like calendars, reminders and apps didn't quite capture the simplicity I was looking for. That sparked an idea: Why not craft an app tailored for this very need? Thus, happy was born.

title: Piasso
description: In four weeks, I developed Piasso, the first AI application that generates images from text in several languages, including Arabic, German, and Spanish. I replicated ChatGPT's functionalities using the DaVinci model and included unique features such as a prompt library and a search function. Piasso is my first iOS app that has been approved on the App Store and is currently being used by thousands of active users.

title: biddz
description: biddz is a platform aimed at fostering a closer connection between music fans and artists. I helped the founders transform the idea into a product used by tens of thousands of users. We conceptualized, designed, and built the initial version while assembling a team to continue enhancing the product.

title: Chair for Computational Social Sciences and Humanities
description: The group works on understanding social systems and modeling human behavior using computational methods. As the 4th member to join, I was responsible for the conceptualisation, design, and development of the website and also built various tools to automate the correction of student assignments.

title: SongGPT
description: SongGPT is one of my favorite side projects. It allowed me to explore the potential of LLMs in generating music compositions. Through this project, I learned a lot about prompt engineering, machine-generated artificial sounds, and good user experience design. The app allows users to generate a song from any text, such as a poem, lyrics, or a quote, or by selecting a color using the picker.

title: Custom BlueSky Client
description: Intrigued by the rise of BlueSky, I decided to build an early version of a custom iOS client to gain a deeper understanding of how the ATProto Protocol works. I also made the code available on my Github for education purposes.

title: ChessGPT
description: I built a chess app to play against ChatGPT. I used prompt engineering techniques to represent the board in a text format and interpreted ChatGPT's response as a move on the chessboard. I did the project out of curiosity to explore the limitations of LLMs in reasoning.

title: AskVisionOS
description: After Apple announced the Vision Pro, my curiosity led me to watch all the videos about Vision OS. I then developed a plugin using the information I gathered from Apple to answer my own questions about Vision OS. Right now, it's just for my private use and I haven't released it yet.

title: M.Sc. Computational Social Systems
description: The M.Sc. Computational Social Systems program is a unique interdisciplinary course at the intersection of computer science, social sciences, cognitive sciences and ethics. I was solely responsible for conceptualising, designing, and developing the website.

title: IT for Kids
description: IT for Kids is a non-profit education partner for primary schools, promoting digital literacy and programming skills. Its mission is to enable all children to learn programming from primary school age. As a student at the University, I was responsible for conceptualising, designing, and building the IT for Kids website.

title: Zima
description: Zima is a browser extension enabling users to save and search their OpenAI chat transcripts.
